ghostPost.title: Chronological posts
ghostPost.excerpt: Learn how to implement chronological content collections on your publication.
ghostPost.meta_title: Creating chronological posts with Ghost - Tutorials
ghostPost.meta_description: Learn how to implement chronological content collections on your Ghost publication using the flexible routing configuration layer!
ghostPost.plaintext:
Posts on any index page in Ghost will be displayed in reverse chronological
order by default, but it's possible to display posts in chronological order
using the data property in the routes.yaml  file. 

If you have created content collections using the dynamic routing configuration
layer in Ghost, and would like to display your content chronologically, this can
be implemented using one extra line of code. 

Create content collections
If you haven't already created a content collection, follow this tutorial first
[https://docs.ghost.org/tutorials/creating-content-collections/]. Once you have
a functional content collection rendering a distinct section on your site with
it's own URL structure, you will be able to transform it from reverse
chronological to chronological using this tutorial. 

Download the routes.yaml  file
Ensure you are working with the most recent version of your routes.yaml  file by
downloading it from the settings in Ghost admin and opening it with any code
editor. 

Use the order property in collections
Using the example below, let's assume that the /blog/  collection should remain
reverse chronological, and the /podcast/  collection should be chronological:

collections:
  /blog/:
    permalink: /blog/{slug}/
    filter: primary_tag:blog
  /podcast/:
    permalink: /podcast/{slug}/
    filter: primary_tag:podcast


Use the order  property with it's two parameters asc  or desc  to determine
ascending or descending order. For example:

collections:
  /blog/:
    permalink: /blog/{slug}/
    filter: primary_tag:blog
    order: desc
  /podcast/:
    permalink: /podcast/{slug}/
    filter: primary_tag:podcast
    order: asc


Implement your collections and templates
Once you have set the order for your posts to be rendered for your collections,
upload the new version of your routes.yaml  file back into the settings in Ghost
admin. If you've made any changes to templates or CSS, ensure you also upload
the latest version of your theme as a .zip. 

When this is done, check your publication to ensure the index page of the
collection you wanted to render in chronological order is working as expected. 

Summary
In this tutorial you have successfully rendered chronological content in one or
more collections on your site. It's possible to do this with any distinct
sections of content on a Ghost publication as required.
